definition: variant of 抹殺|抹杀[mo3 sha1]
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
variant of 一筆抹殺|一笔抹杀[yi1 bi3 mo3 sha1]

sentences.english: No controversy will erase the historic impact.
sentences.chinese: 無論怎樣的論辯也不能抹煞他的這一歷史影響。

sentences.english: There's no reason that racial diversity should be eliminated from that criteria.
sentences.chinese: 所以，沒有理由把人種的多樣從這些標準中抹煞掉。

sentences.english: This is easier than to take them back or efface their impression afterward.
sentences.chinese: 這總比事後把話收回來或抹煞所留下的印象更爲容易。

sentences.english: Suffering is an ineradicable part of life, even as fate and death p.
sentences.chinese: 就像命運與死亡，受苦是生命無可抹煞的一部份。

sentences.english: The model minority myth renders all those distinctions moot.
sentences.chinese: 少數模範人物的神話把這些差異全都抹煞了。

definition: to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to blot out at one stroke/to reject out of hand/to deny without a hearing
variant of 一筆抹殺|一笔抹杀[yi1 bi3 mo3 sha1]
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
